update.description:
I tried `changelog_spawn` and I think it works, but I haven't fully tested `release.py` yet.

The changes are meant to be backwards compatible, so releasing bitbucket repos wouldn't change.

## Usage

Use changelog as usual:

`changelog_spawn.sh 3.5.2-1`

For release, add `--github`:

`release.py -r 1 ign-math3 3.0.0 --ignition-repo -a ignition-math3 --github --dry-run`
update.title: Start porting release process to GitHub

pull_request.title: Start porting release process to GitHub

pullrequest.title: Start porting release process to GitHub

content.raw:
I made some changes:

* Support in DSL \(and params in release.py\) for the GITHUB\_RELEASE variable \(needed for release.py → build.bash communication\)
* Auto detection for github/bitbucket release repositories

    * Remove the --github parameter to simplify the release.py process
    * release.py will take care of checking if the release repository exists in Bitbucket and fallback to check github
    
* Added sdformat9 to list of debbuilder in sdformat DSL

The first success build with github for -release repos:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat9-debbuilder&build=10)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat9-debbuilder/10/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat9-debbuilder/10/))

‌

‌
content.html:
I made some changes:

  • Support in DSL (and params in release.py) for the GITHUB_RELEASE variable (needed for release.py → build.bash communication)

  • Auto detection for github/bitbucket release repositories

    • Remove the --github parameter to simplify the release.py process
    • release.py will take care of checking if the release repository exists in Bitbucket and fallback to check github

  • Added sdformat9 to list of debbuilder in sdformat DSL

The first success build with github for -release repos:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat9-debbuilder/10/)

‌

‌

pullrequest.title: Start porting release process to GitHub

content.raw:
> The Linux build is failing because we need more changes inside the release-tools scripts

Yeah I realized that we need changes at least in `debbuild-base.bash`.

>  Is the sdformat9-release repo only a test or from now the plan is to have the new ones in github?

It's just a test for now. If we get to make it work while not breaking the mercurial release repos, we could start putting all the new ones into github.

> At this point I’m afraid that we end up with a good mess of -release repositories spread between bitbucket/github with the risk of having duplicates in both. Not sure if it would make things easier to change all them at the same time. 

That's a good point, maybe moving them all at once would be easier than trying to support both mercurial and git? I was hoping to be the least intrusive as possible. But come to think of it, the release repos should be simple enough to migrate, since they don't usually have issues.

Let's talk about this during the meeting
content.html:
The Linux build is failing because we need more changes inside the release-tools scripts

Yeah I realized that we need changes at least in debbuild-base.bash.

Is the sdformat9-release repo only a test or from now the plan is to have the new ones in github?

It's just a test for now. If we get to make it work while not breaking the mercurial release repos, we could start putting all the new ones into github.

At this point I’m afraid that we end up with a good mess of -release repositories spread between bitbucket/github with the risk of having duplicates in both. Not sure if it would make things easier to change all them at the same time.

That's a good point, maybe moving them all at once would be easier than trying to support both mercurial and git? I was hoping to be the least intrusive as possible. But come to think of it, the release repos should be simple enough to migrate, since they don't usually have issues.

Let's talk about this during the meeting

Not sure if it would make things easier to change all them at the same time.

content.raw:
* Created the `sdformat9-release` repo on GitHub: https://github.com/ignition-release/sdformat9-release
* Created the [sdformat9](#!/osrf/release-tools/commits/c3b660e7b400cff611f206b5f6a1767c35e252ab) branch on this repo
* Triggered `_dsl_sdformat` with that branch and created https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat9-debbuilder/
* And triggered a `sdformat9.0.0~pre1` pre-release using this branch:
    * Homebrew: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/540/badge/icon)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/540/), https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/884
    * Linux: queued in https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat9-debbuilder/
content.html:
• Created the sdformat9-release repo on GitHub: https://github.com/ignition-release/sdformat9-release
  • Created the sdformat9 branch on this repo
  • Triggered _dsl_sdformat with that branch and created https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat9-debbuilder/
  • And triggered a sdformat9.0.0~pre1 pre-release using this branch:
    • Homebrew: , https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/884
    • Linux: queued in https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat9-debbuilder/

update.description:
I tried `changelog_spawn` and I think it works, but I haven't fully tested `release.py` yet.

The changes are meant to be backwards compatible, so releasing bitbucket repos wouldn't change.

## Usage

For changelog, add an empty message `""` and `git`, i.e.

`changelog_spawn.sh 3.5.2-1 "" git`

For release, add `--github`:

`release.py -r 1 ign-math3 3.0.0 --ignition-repo -a ignition-math3 --github --dry-run`
update.title: [WIP] Start porting release process to GitHub
